name: appsactivity
title: G Suite Activity API
description: Provides a historical view of activity.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

schemas.name: PermissionChange
schemas.desc: Contains information about a Drive object's permissions that changed as a result of a permissionChange type event.

fields.name: addedPermissions
fields.desc: Lists all Permission objects added.

fields.name: removedPermissions
fields.desc: Lists all Permission objects removed.

fields.name: url
fields.desc: The URL of the photo.

schemas.name: Rename
schemas.desc: Contains information about a renametype event.

fields.name: newTitle
fields.desc: The new title.

fields.name: oldTitle
fields.desc: The old title.

schemas.name: Move
schemas.desc: Contains information about changes in an object's parents as a result of a move type event.

fields.name: addedParents
fields.desc: The added parent(s).

fields.name: removedParents
fields.desc: The removed parent(s).

schemas.name: Parent
schemas.desc: Contains information about a parent object. For example, a folder in Drive is a parent for all files within it.

fields.name: isRoot
fields.desc: Whether this is the root folder.

fields.name: title
fields.desc: The parent's title.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The parent's ID.

schemas.name: Permission
schemas.desc: Contains information about the permissions and type of access allowed with regards to a Google Drive object. This is a subset of the fields contained in a corresponding Drive Permissions object.

fields.name: withLink
fields.desc: Whether the permission requires a link to the file.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of the user or group the permission applies to.

fields.name: permissionId
fields.desc: The ID for this permission. Corresponds to the Drive API's permission ID returned as part of the Drive Permissions resource.

fields.name: role
fields.desc: Indicates the Google Drive permissions role. The role determines a user's ability to read, write, or comment on the file.

fields.name: type
fields.desc: Indicates how widely permissions are granted.

fields.name: user
fields.desc: The user's information if the type is USER.

schemas.name: Target
schemas.desc: Information about the object modified by the event.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of the target. For example, in Google Drive, this is the title of the file.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The ID of the target. For example, in Google Drive, this is the file or folder ID.

fields.name: mimeType
fields.desc: The MIME type of the target.

fields.name: permissionId
fields.desc: The permission ID associated with this user. Equivalent to the Drive API's permission ID for this user, returned as part of the Drive Permissions resource.

fields.name: photo
fields.desc: The profile photo of the user. Not present if the user has no profile photo.

fields.name: isDeleted
fields.desc: A boolean which indicates whether the specified User was deleted. If true, name, photo and permission_id will be omitted.

fields.name: isMe
fields.desc: Whether the user is the authenticated user.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The displayable name of the user.

schemas.name: Activity
schemas.desc: An Activity resource is a combined view of multiple events. An activity has a list of individual events and a combined view of the common fields among all events.

fields.name: combinedEvent
fields.desc: The fields common to all of the singleEvents that make up the Activity.

fields.name: singleEvents
fields.desc: A list of all the Events that make up the Activity.

schemas.name: Event
schemas.desc: Represents the changes associated with an action taken by a user.

fields.name: move
fields.desc: Extra information for move type events, such as changes in an object's parents.

fields.name: permissionChanges
fields.desc: Extra information for permissionChange type events, such as the user or group the new permission applies to.

fields.name: rename
fields.desc: Extra information for rename type events, such as the old and new names.

fields.name: fromUserDeletion
fields.desc: Whether this event is caused by a user being deleted.

fields.name: eventTimeMillis
fields.desc: The time at which the event occurred formatted as Unix time in milliseconds.

fields.name: primaryEventType
fields.desc: The main type of event that occurred.

fields.name: target
fields.desc: Information specific to the Target object modified by the event.

fields.name: user
fields.desc: Represents the user responsible for the event.

fields.name: additionalEventTypes
fields.desc: Additional event types. Some events may have multiple types when multiple actions are part of a single event. For example, creating a document, renaming it, and sharing it may be part of a single file-creation event.

schemas.name: ListActivitiesResponse
schemas.desc: The response from the list request. Contains a list of activities and a token to retrieve the next page of results.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc: Token for the next page of results.

fields.name: activities
fields.desc: List of activities.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Returns a list of activities visible to the current logged in user. Visible activities are determined by the visiblity settings of the object that was acted on, e.g. Drive files a user can see. An activity is a record of past events. Multiple events may be merged if they are similar. A request is scoped to activities from a given Google service using the source parameter.

optinalQueryParams.name: userId
optinalQueryParams.desc: Indicates the user to return activity for. Use the special value me to indicate the currently authenticated user.

optinalQueryParams.name: drive.ancestorId
optinalQueryParams.desc: Identifies the Drive folder containing the items for which to return activities.

optinalQueryParams.name: drive.fileId
optinalQueryParams.desc: Identifies the Drive item to return activities for.

optinalQueryParams.name: groupingStrategy
optinalQueryParams.desc: Indicates the strategy to use when grouping singleEvents items in the associated combinedEvent object.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageSize
optinalQueryParams.desc: The maximum number of events to return on a page. The response includes a continuation token if there are more events.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc: A token to retrieve a specific page of results.

optinalQueryParams.name: source
optinalQueryParams.desc:
The Google service from which to return activities. Possible values of source are: 
- drive.google.com
